paper.title: Information, beliefs and support for retaliatory tariffs on US agricultural products: evidence from a randomised controlled trial in China
paper.abstract: The US–China trade war has profoundly reshaped global agricultural markets, yet the consequences of protectionist measures for domestic public attitudes—particularly within collectivist societies like China—have been underexplored. This study investigates how Chinese citizens perceive retaliatory tariffs on US agricultural products and explores how awareness of economic self-interest shapes their support for such policies.

rating_rebalance.quota_description: 精确1:1配额（基础50本，余数0分配给前0个星级）
